diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Congenital Hypothyroidism due to TPO mutations
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with congenital hypothyroidism and goiter, alongside bilateral moderate hearing loss. Initially suspected to have Pendred syndrome, further genetic analysis revealed a monoallelic mutation in SLC26A4/PDS and compound heterozygous mutations in TPO, which are consistent with goitrous hypothyroidism but not PS, as the hearing impairment was moderate rather than severe.
